abstract.value:
Ralph Fasanella (1914-1997) was a
        Abraham Lincoln Brigade veteran, painter, and United Electrical, Radio and Machine Workers
        of America Local 1227 organizer. This collection contains his papers, correspondence, and
        photographs, the bulk of which are from 1970-1993. There are some materials from Spain
        during the Spanish Civil War.

Identification of item, date; Ralph Fasanella Papers and Photographs; ALBA 235; box number;
        folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

Ralph Fasanella, born September 7, 1914, was a self-taught painter whose large, detailed
        works depict urban working life. The child of Italian immigrants, Fasanella was born and
        raised in the Bronx and later became a member of United Electrical, Radio and Machine
        Workers of America (UE) Local 1227 while working as a machinist in Brooklyn. Fasanella also
        fought in the Spanish Civil War with the Abraham Lincoln Brigade and after returning from
        the war began to work as a union organizer for the UE. Fasanella died on December 18,
        1997.

This collection contains the photographs and papers of Ralph Fasanella, the bulk of which
        are from 1970-1993. There is some material from Spain during the Spanish Civil War. The
        collection contains correspondence from friends, activists, school children, and art world
        figures. Prominent correspondences include Milton Wolfe and Ernest DiMaio. Other materials
        in the collections include materials from Fasanella's 1949 campaign for New York City
        Council on the American Labor Party slate, exhibit materials including a guest book, lecture
        notes, press clippings on his career, research notes about Lawrence, Massachusetts,
        brochures, and an oversized magazine entitled, "Un Ano de las Brigadas Internacionales"
        (Spanish). A significant portion of the collection contains color and black-and-white
        photographs, some of Fasanella at work or a show. There are also some photographs of
        Fasanella and others taken in Spain during the Spanish Civil War. It also includes a jacket
        and trousers worn by Fasanella in Spain.
